lines.text: I hate her! I hate that queen!
She's jealous!
Twenty-six million miles from Earth, and the little dolls are just the same.
Why don't you girls knock off all this Gestapo stuff and try to be a little friendly.
If I see any of those little green men, I'll faint. The sound of my body falling will wake you up.
Nah, I wouldn't worry. The fire ought to keep 'em away.
Perhaps this is a civilization that exists without sex.
You call that civilization?
Frankly, no.
I'm going to allow myself the exquisite pleasure of watching you while I obliterate the Earth.
I know you men are anxious to return home, but you must endure your privations and hardships.
Hiya, dolls. Glad to hear you're on our side.
I didn't say anything to the Queen. I didn't want to put her on guard, but I'm beginning to think our being here is not an accident.
I'm afraid I must agree with you.
What is that? What is that?
The ray that destroyed the space station and knocked us off our course may have originated right here.
Oh, come off it! How could a bunch of women invent a gizmo like that?
Sure, and even if they invented it, how could they aim it? You know how women drivers are!

[reacting to the Venusians and their ray guns]
They speak English!
Go, go, go!
I believe we better accept the invitation
Yeah, the way those shooting irons of theirs work, I'm with you, Doc.
Well, you heard what the babe said.
How did she manage to overthrow the men?
They didn't take her seriously. They were preparing for war. After all, she was only a woman.
Then we're the only men on the whole planet?

[after a pause]
Yes.
Wow, no wonder they locked us up!
Your veapons are here. We're going to teach you how to use them.
I love you.
If love is what makes your heart sing, then I love you too.
It's monstrous! Will nothing keep you from going through with this?
Nothing, Professor!
You don't just accidentally land on a planet 36,000.000 miles away!
It would appear that all things are possible in space.
How can a doll as cute as that be such a pain in the neck?
Silence... Man!
Let me see your face.
Ahhhh
[as her mask is pulled off]
! Radiation burns. Men did this to me, men and their wars. You say I need the love of a man. Very well. Now that you know, will you give me that love?
[drawing her hideously disfigured face toward the captain's]
I didn't realize!
